channel.title: Posh-ACME on Adventures in Tech
channel.description: Recent content in Posh-ACME on Adventures in Tech

item.title: Posh-ACME 3.6.0
item.description: Just shipped a new Posh-ACME release, version 3.6.0. This one has a bunch of new stuff including new plugins for Domeneshop, Dreamhost, EasyDNS, and freedns.afraid.org. The other big addition is a new function called Invoke-HttpChallengeListener which can be super handy for people doing HTTP challenges. It’s basically a self-contained webserver that will respond to requests for the HTTP challenges in your order so you don’t have manually deal with making the challenge files available.

item.title: Posh-ACME 3.5.0
item.description: Just shipped a new Posh-ACME release, version 3.5.0. This one has an important fix due to a recent change in Let’s Encrypt’s ACME implementation which now more strictly adheres to the recently finalized RFC 8555 spec. The Let’s Encrypt change is only on the staging server at the moment, but it will likely move to production soon and it breaks account creation on all previous versions of Posh-ACME. Updated versions can be found in the PowerShell Gallery or GitHub.
